metadata.title: CVE-2021-3326 on Ubuntu 22.10 (kinetic) - low.
metadata.description:
The iconv function in the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) 2.32 and earlier, when processing invalid input sequences in the ISO-2022-JP-3 encoding, fails an assertion in the code path and aborts the program, potentially resulting in a denial of service.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-3326` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

glibc-source - 2.33-0ubuntu5
libc-bin - 2.33-0ubuntu5
libc6 - 2.33-0ubuntu5
libc6-amd64 - 2.33-0ubuntu5
libc6-i386 - 2.33-0ubuntu5
libc6-prof - 2.33-0ubuntu5
libc6-s390 - 2.33-0ubuntu5
libc6-x32 - 2.33-0ubuntu5
locales - 2.33-0ubuntu5
locales-all - 2.33-0ubuntu5
nscd - 2.33-0ubuntu5
No subscription required

criterions.comment: glibc package in kinetic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.33-0ubuntu5').
